page.title: 07MEDMENHAM VILLAGE
page.content: It consists mainly of one road called Ferry Lane that leads from the River Thames to the main Henley-Marlow road. It is the only remaining riverside village in Buckinghamshire.The population of Medmenham is approximately 1100.There is no gas or main drainage. It was mentioned in the Domesday Book.In the riverside garden of a private house are the remains of the 13th century Cistercian Abbey and additions built by Sir Francis Dashwood who in the late 18th century entertained artists,writers,poets and politicians.Their coterie became known as the Hell Fire Club. The village church of St. Michaels was founded in 650A.D.Opposite it is The Dog and Badger built in 1390.
